parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.32

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Arrays

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Removes a range of array elements from the given array (modifies the original array, just like [[resize]] or [[set]]).

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> array '''deleteRange''' [from, count]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> array: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [from, count]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> from: [[Number]] - Array index to start selection from.
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> count: [[Number]] - Number of array elements to remove. If the selected range exceeds source array boundaries, selection will be made up to the end of the array.

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_arr = [1,2,3,4,5,6];
_arr [[deleteRange]] [1,4];
[[hint]] [[str]] _arr; //[1,6]</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[deleteAt]], [[set]], [[resize]], [[select]], [[in]], [[find]], [[toArray]], [[toString]], [[forEach]], [[count]], [[pushBack]], [[pushBackUnique]], [[apply]], [[append]], [[sort]], [[param]], [[params]], [[arrayIntersect]], [[splitString]], [[joinString]]
</value></part></template>
